quote_first: Robert Townsend woke before the alarm sounded and lay listening in the dark. Something had disturbed his sleep - a noise outside. A distant but distinct crack. He glanced at the hands of the clock on the nightstand.
quote_last: . Crack. Crack. Crack. There it was again. What on earth could it be?
title: Cogheart
author: Peter Bunzl

quote_last: . ‘Rob’s boys were already on the platform, barrows ready. The only thing that ever dared to be late around here was the train. Rob’s boys were in fact Bill Bing, thirty, sucking a Woodbine, and Arthur, sixty, half dead.
title: The Peculiar Memories of Thomas Penman
author: Bruce Robinson
